timeline.bodyText: This seems like 2 calls  the UI service could do as well (or at least the setFxStage). What do you think?
timeline.author: Brutus5000

timeline.bodyText: Unrelated question: Why is there no return here? Or at least a log statement to catch potential user problems?
timeline.author: Brutus5000

replies.bodyText: This code runs when the application is shutting down. Geosearchef added it to help finding which non-daemon threads keep the client alive. There isn't much to be handled
replies.author: micheljung

timeline.bodyText: Could be replaced by Lomboks AllArgConstructor
timeline.author: Brutus5000

replies.bodyText: Unfortunately not, because of the varargs parameter
replies.author: micheljung

timeline.bodyText:
Instead of collection and addAll you could do a foreach and add
Maybe extract the stream into a tiny method
timeline.author: Brutus5000

replies.bodyText: ObservableList.setAll() triggers one change event, repeatedly calling add() triggers multiple change events.
replies.author: micheljung

timeline.bodyText:
The complexity of this class is very high and self-explanatory code is not given here anymore imho.
Either a Javadoc or some other kind of restructuring is necessary:

The parent is implicitly expected to be a list cell - but you only see this from the cast in line 23.
There is a onRemoveButtonClicked method, but nowhere is stated that this controller is supposed to contain a button. So the name is misleading here.
Also the purpose of the label remains unclear. What is "channel" supposed to be?
timeline.author: Brutus5000

replies.bodyText: I was able to simplify this; it's now a ListCell that's a controller at the same time. Code is simpler and JavaDoc added.
replies.author: micheljung

timeline.bodyText: What is this value referring to? A translation code?
timeline.author: Brutus5000

replies.bodyText:
ReadOnlyProperty.getName():

Returns the name of this property. If the property does not have a name, this method returns an empty String.
replies.author: micheljung

timeline.bodyText: Thanks captain! Comment can be removed
timeline.author: Brutus5000

replies.bodyText: Dialog and Alert are ported from JFoenix. I cleaned up the code but didn't catch it all :-)
replies.author: micheljung

timeline.bodyText:
A JavaDoc would be helpful here:
How is this different from a VBox?
When should this be used?
How to use this from SceneBuilder or fxml?
timeline.author: Brutus5000

replies.bodyText: Ported from JFoenix. A DialogLayout has a header, a body and action buttons and is the content of a Dialog. Eventually, we might get rid of it but for now, we're transitioning away from JFoenix so we kept this class.
replies.author: micheljung

timeline.bodyText: If only one case is covered I'd prefer if/else
timeline.author: Brutus5000

timeline.bodyText:
From what I see mementos can never be null.
Also I'd suggest Arrays.stream(mementos).foreach(CacheMemento::cache)
timeline.author: Brutus5000

timeline.bodyText:
From what I see mementos can never be null.
Also I'd suggest Arrays.stream(mementos).foreach(CacheMemento::restore)
timeline.author: Brutus5000
Brutus5000

timeline.bodyText: Not sure what u mean here. But I guess u need to find out what icon corresponds to this unicode. I guess if u dont, then leave the old code and add the fix me
timeline.author: 1-alex98

replies.bodyText: Did you look at the discussion 58357c6#r40460680? An icon was added, but it was done by directly modifying the font rather than adding it via icomoon. This icon is lost in current client version and I wasn't even able to look it up using the font from his commit. So whether or not I leave the old code, there is no icon.
replies.author: micheljung
